alert.note: Alert for Cottle; Dickens; Kent; King; Motley; Stonewall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 02 at 6:29PM CDT until June 02 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock Texas has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Kent County in northwestern Texas... Dickens County in northwestern Texas... King County in northwestern Texas... Southeastern Motley County in northwestern Texas... Southwestern Cottle County in northwestern Texas... Stonewall County in northwestern Texas... * Until 730 PM CDT. * At 629 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of Afton to 7 miles northeast of Girard to 7 miles southeast of Lake Alan Henry, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Spur, Aspermont, Jayton, Dickens, Guthrie, Lake Alan Henry, Girard, Afton, Clairemont, Grow, Peacock, Dumont, Finney, Delwin, Chalk, Swenson and Roaring Springs. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern Texas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Cottle; Dickens; Kent; King; Motley; Stonewall
